poem:
Title: No Man's Land

Time merely whispers in the corners of law,
Uncurtained, stark, in cold, steel corridors.
Of man and isle, a battle waged long
In limbo-dance, stunted in the bloom of youth.
Henry, of Jamaica fertile, dreams in clover,
Years strung in silence, inching towards a door.
His heart, a quiet lantern, in a decade's gloom,
Will hope ignite, his native land no more?
